questions.question: Which factor primarily contributes to the development of hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction?
options: Increased carbon dioxide in arterial blood

questions.question: What is the typical respiratory compensation in metabolic acidosis?
options: Decreased tidal volume and increased PCO₂

questions.question: What is the key feature of restrictive lung diseases?
Which of the following is the primary cause of cyanosis?
options: Hypoxemia leading to increased deoxygenated hemoglobin
Increased oxygen saturation of arterial blood
